name: Roberts Riverwalk Hotel Detroit

reviews.text: We booked via Hotwire and got an excellent rate for a 3.5 star hotel. I was not impressed, even with the discounted rate. The rooms are very small and dated. The amenities are less than a Holiday Inn and the customer service leaves much to be desired. They ran out of towels. What hotel runs out of towels? The front desks takes requests and doesn't follow through. This happened serveral times with serveral requests like for toilet paper, towels, and maintenance.
reviews.title: Not worth the money
This could be an amazing hotel.
reviews.text: The location is very good, and unlike anything else in Detroit. The building itself is elegant with an old luxury feel that is comfortable without being pretentious. Our room was huge by modern standards, with high ceilings and enough floor space to easily accomodate the king-size bed, wide-screen TV, large coffee table, and a full pull-out couch. The two large windows would have offered a wonderful view of the river if I had thought to ask.

The entire staff was very friendly and helpful, however this did not seem to translate into a well-run hotel. It was difficult to distinguish between the staff and guests without traditional uniforms or name tags. There seemed to be a lot of people standing around trying to look busy, but I couldn't always tell if they were employees or not. At a glance, they seem over staffed for the work that was actually being done, and there is plenty of work that needs to be done in this hotel.
reviews.title: Classic property in an out-of-the-way location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many of the little details that make a luxury hotel stand apart from the crowd are missing from Robert's Riverwalk Hotel. Our room was not dirty like some other reviews have stated, but it wasn't spotless either. The bed linen's were crisp and spotless but the couch was dingy and old. The room decor was pleasant, but there one of the walls had plugs in the drywall where a picture was missing. The widescreen TV was the perfect modern addition to the room, but the remote control didn't work for anything but on and off. The in-room coffee pot didn't have the right filter for it and the ice bucket lid didn't fit because it was from a different bucket. All of my complaints are minor, but they could be easily addressed with some careful attention to detail.
reviews.title: Hidden Treasure

reviews.text: My only real complaint was that the hotel was hosting an open-mic event in the lounge downstairs that went until 2:00 am, and I could hear the music playing in my room the entire time. I still slept pretty well because of the extremely comfortable bed and a white noise app on my iPad, but I would certainly request a second-story room away from the lounge if I stay there again.
reviews.title: staying for a month

reviews.text: This hotel is in a refurbished turn of the century industrial building right along the river and about a mile from downtown Detroit. It's a different concept than than most hotels, but the team running this is doing a very nice job. I had a nice conversation with one of the managers and they have apparently made some changes recently and are working to make this a first class property.
reviews.title: Classy

reviews.text: My room was larger than most other hotels and very nicely furnished in sort of a retro theme. Overall it had a very elegant style. Room was very clean and quiet. I thought that the room could have used just a bit more light though for doing paperwork in the evening, but that's a minor point.
reviews.title: Please read before booking...

reviews.text: The staff I encountered from front-desk attendants, van driver and server were all very gracious and went out of the way to make me feel welcome.There is not much around the hotel, so I ate in the bar/restaurant both nights of my stay and the food and service were very good. There is a free breakfast, but it consists of just a muffin and coffee. A full breakfast is available in the restaurant also.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.text: This would be a nice location for a weekend getaway or other event. Definitely worth consideration.
reviews.title: The WORST hotel in America....

reviews.text: This is the first time I am writing a review; however I think it is really important to inform potential consumers. I stayed here four nights last week. The hotel was booked through Priceline's bidding process, therefore I could not cancel.

reviews.title: I really, really, wanted to like this hotel...

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel this past weekend while my son participated in "Autorama". The hotel was decorated really beautifully, quiet & the manager & other hotel staff were EXTREMELY helpful! The hotel staff went out of their way to make sure my visit was most enjoyable. The Manager upgraded my room for me (which I wasn't expecting) & gave me a late checkout. It really made my stay exceptional! The views of the river from my hotel room were just beautiful! Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was absolutely delicious! I didn't want to ever leave. I plan to stay there again when I am in the Detroit area & highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A Most Unique Hotel Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a beautiful location right next to the Detroit River. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and the bed was amazingly comfortable. The only downside to this hotel is the parking situation. Kind of tough to get a decent spot after it gets late...we had to park in an adjoining field. Other than that, we would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Beautiful location

reviews.text: My family stayed in two adjoining rooms for a week at Christmas and had a pleasant stay. Occupancy was low and staffing was light. The location on the waterfront and proximity to downtown makes it very attractive. It is in an old warehouse district with significant redevelopment (condos,etc). It is something like a jewel with risk--or unpredictability. The rooms are big with high ceilings and nicely furnished. Housekeeping and maintenance was mediocre. The staff was very accomodating but handling multiple duties. They were dealing with problems like having to scrounge through unoccupied rooms to find enough clean towels. It felt like ownership was not delivering consistent resources (staffing, materials) so management could deliver a consistent experience. There was a party down the hall that went late into the night--so I wonder with another commenter if the property is attracting that crowd.
reviews.title: Unique property for content people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend property for those looking for a nice, old property in unique setting; but not if you need every amenity and service to be predictably and readily available. If you are a content person, willing to flex, and enjoy a pleasant jewel--this might be for you.
reviews.title: We usually have never had complaints, But this Time is Different ....

reviews.text: The Accomodations were , the usuall, elegant amenities that we have come to expect from this Hotel. However this weekend 2/23/2013, things with the Staff were just plain "WRONG". To begin it took us 49 minutes to check in. It was busy , yes, but the Gentleman who was handling check in was just plain "SLOW". Not to mention there was another gentleman who was directing traffic from behind the counter was actually in the way. He coud have asssited with the check in and expediated matters, But he did'nt , He was simply in the Way.
reviews.title: Don't be afraid of Detroit
